result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan R Christiansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs and DNA Surcharge. Any bond posted is to be applied to fine/costs. Balance due   Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

May serve second half of 10 days on electronic monitoring program, if Defendant qualifies, have to go through an evaluation.
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan R Christiansen in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will enter a plea to Count 1.
State caps at 30 days jail, costs and surcharges. Defense is free to argue.

Atty Redfield concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Disorderly Conduct

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends lesser days jail for reasons stated on the record.

Defendant addresses the Court.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court reviews the complaint.
PBT: .229

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 20 Days
0 days jail credit
May serve second 10 on electronic monitoring program if Defendant qualifies, have to go through an evaluation
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Any bond posted is to be applied to fine/costs

ADDRESS INFO for Alan R Christiansen
Current: N211 County Rd A, Amherst Junction, WI 54407 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2016)
Prior: 211 Cty Tk A N, Amherst Junction, WI 54407
Plea hearing on June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cash previously posted. 
No contact with White Tail Lanes.
No contact with Stephen Cieslewicz. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Alan R Christiansen in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Defendant makes statements.  Has not been able to find an attorney.  
Court questions defendant. 
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on the defendant's behalf. 

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant questions the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
